alert.note: Alert for Florence; Forest; Langlade; Lincoln; Marathon; Menominee; Northern Marinette County; Northern Oconto County; Oneida; Southern Marinette County; Vilas (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 22 at 10:31AM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...SNOW WILL INCREASE MID-DAY, COULD BE HEAVY A TIMES THIS AFTERNOON... At 1025 am, radar and surface weather observations indicated occasional light snow and flurries across north-central, far northeast, and portions of central Wisconsin. An expanding area of moderate to occasionally heavy mixed precipitation was over the southwest part of the state. That precipitation is expected to continue to expand and spread northeast, and will overspread central and northern Wisconsin during the mid-day hours. It should transition to all snow by the time it arrives in the area. So snow should be widespread across the area during the mid to late afternoon, and it could be heavy at times. Northeast winds gusting to about 25 mph may produce some blowing and drifting of the snow. Roads were reported to already be snow covered and slippery, and travel conditions will likely worsen considerably once the snow picks up during the afternoon. Anyone traveling across the area today should be prepared for hazardous travel conditions, and allow extra time to reach their destination.
